org.transitime.ipc.servers

Class ConfigServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.transitime.ipc.rmi.AbstractServer
      • org.transitime.ipc.servers.ConfigServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote, ConfigInterface

    public class ConfigServer
extends AbstractServer
implements ConfigInterface
    Implements ConfigInterface to serve up configuration information to RMI clients.
    Author:
    SkiBu Smith

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public static ConfigServer start(java.lang.String agencyId)
        Starts up the ConfigServer so that RMI calls can query for configuration data. This will automatically cause the object to continue to run and serve requests.
        Parameters:
        agencyId -
        Returns:
        the singleton ConfigServer object. Usually does not need to used since the server will be fully running.

      • getRoutes

      • getRoute

        public IpcRoute getRoute(java.lang.String routeIdOrShortName,
                         java.lang.String directionId,
                         java.lang.String stopId,
                         java.lang.String tripPatternId)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: ConfigInterface
        Obtains data for single route.
        Specified by:
        getRoute in interface ConfigInterface
        Parameters:
        routeIdOrShortName - Specifies which route to provide data for. routeShortName is often used instead of routeId since routeIds unfortunately often change when there is a schedule change.
        directionId - optional. If want UI to highlight the remaining stops and paths left in the trip then can specify directionId along with the stopId. The directionId can be needed for agencies where only a single stop is used for both directions for a route.
        stopId - optional. If want UI to highlight the remaining stops and paths left in trip then stopId is used to return which stops remain in trip. If this additional info not needed for UI then null can be specified.
        tripPatternId - optional. If want UI to highlight the remaining stops and paths left in trip then stopId is used to determine which trip pattern to highlight. If this additional info not needed for UI then null can be specified.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
